reasoning: MCAD deficiency is a rare autosomal recessive metabolic disorder. Incidence estimated 1 per 10,000-20,000 newborns globally, approximately 0.07-0.10 per 100k live births. Prevalence varies by region and screening practices.
source: Zytkovicz TH et al. (2001). Tandem mass spectrometric analysis for amino, acyl-carnitine, and organic acids in newborn screening. Clin Chem. 47(11):1945-1955
